name: Anubhav Lamsal

highlights: Contributed to an OpenAI GPT Realtime voicebot that automates customer calls, appointment bookings, and storage reservations through MCP tool calls, service APIs, and webhook flows.
Built a race-safe async TTL cache with signal-based refresh; cut appointment-slot lookups from ~1 s network calls to ~7 ms in-memory reads.
Prefetched session-level customer data so the LLM can speak without ~3 s of dead air, making calls feel human-paced.
Designed resilient phone-number extraction across OpenAI payload shapes by generalizing attribute patterns into robust regexes.
Proposed and prototyped merging the call-handling server and MCP server into one deployable unit with custom routes to minimize codebase.
Converted messy customer CSVs into reusable domain entities and Pydantic models for safer, structured use across services.
Merit-based scholarship awarded by the board for outstanding academic performance (Academic Year 2024).

Relevant coursework: OOP, full-stack web development, distributed systems, operating systems, data mining, machine learning, probability theory, linear algebra, software engineering practices (tools and methods).

projects.name: Full-stack Flood Monitoring Application
projects.summary: Flood monitoring application using a 3-tier architecture with map visualization of hourly Austrian water-level datasets.
highlights: Built a 3-tier system: Angular SPA (Leaflet) + Node.js/Express REST API + MongoDB; ingested and served hourly datasets with GeoJSON map layers.
Implemented signup/login/logout, Express auth middleware, and secure cookie/JWT sessions for protected, role-based routes.
Designed the database schema, automated CI/CD with GitHub Actions, containerized with Docker, coordinated SCRUM work, and built an Electron admin tool for database control.

projects.name: EEG-Based Emotional State Classification
projects.summary: Researching whether emotional states can be predicted from EEG signals via feature engineering and deep learning.
highlights: Reviewed prior EEG emotion-classification work to guide preprocessing, spectral feature selection, and baseline comparisons.
Started with 100 raw time-series features and engineered 22 tabular features (delta-gamma band power via Welch and Fourier transforms).
Benchmarked RF, XGBoost, and SVM; a CNN achieved 96% accuracy.
Improved rigor with k-fold cross-validation, dropout, early stopping, and signal/label integrity checks.

projects.name: Bytsey Artstore
projects.summary: Responsive, vintage-themed e-commerce UI built with Next.js, featuring a palette-based image color-shift effect and a lightweight contact workflow.
highlights: Built a responsive UI with reusable components, client-side routing, and pure CSS animations.
Implemented a clustering-based color-shift feature that maps image colors to a selected palette and applies gradient transformations in JavaScript.
Created a contact form that sends product inquiries directly to the owner’s email with no backend overhead; deployed on Vercel.
